title: How to manually add books to my Kindle - Quora

response.answer_text: If the book you wish to put on your Kindle is in a file on your computer, because you downloaded it from the Gutenberg Project for example, then you can either connect computer and kindle via a USB lead and just drag and drop, or (my prefered method) send the book as an email attachment to the kindle’s unique email address. I find this way also preserve the cover, which (for some reason I know not what) is sometimes lost in the physical connection. Your Kindle’s email address can be found on your Kindle in Settings - Your account - Send-to Kindle Email. I have often sent several books at the same time to my kindle and they normally take two or three minutes to appear on the reader.

You can only do it electronically, not manually. I plug in a USB cable and send books from Calibre software on my PC - if they aren’t already in the correct format, Calibre will automagically convert them for me. You can also send them to your Amazon ‘kindle’ email, and Amazon will convert and forward them to your Kindle.
Go to Manage Your Kindle on the Amazon site.Select all the books you want to add.Click the send to button and select your device.Sync your device.
